```{r}
city

```


```{r}

```

```{r}
city <- c("Tuguegarao City", "Manila", "Iloilo City", "Tacloban", "Samal Island", "Davao City")
city

temp <- c(42, 39, 34, 34, 30, 27)
temp

weather <- data.frame(city, temp)
weather

names(weather) <- c("City", "Temperature")
weather


## Row 3 and 4
weather[3:4, ]

## City with the Highest and Lowest temprature
weather[which.max(weather$Temperature), ]
weather[which.min(weather$Temperature), ]

```


## MATRIX

```{r}
m <- matrix(c(1:8, 11:14), nrow = 3, ncol = 4)
m

m * 2

##Displays the content of Row 2
m[2, ]

##Display columns 3 and 4 in rows 1 and 2
m[1:2, 3:4]

##Display only columns 2 and 3 from row 3
m[3, 2:3]

## Displays only column 4
m[, 4]


##Name the rows and columns for the matrix from (b)
m2 <- m * 2
rownames(m2) <- c("isa", "dalawa", "tatlo")
colnames(m2) <- c("uno", "dos", "tres", "quatro")
m2

##Reshape the original matrix (from a)
dim(m) <- c(6, 2)
m

```


## ARRAY

```{r}
values <- rep(c(1, 2, 3, 6, 7, 8, 9, 0, 3, 4, 5, 1), 2)


my_array <- array(values, dim = c(2, 4, 3))
my_array

##How many dimensions does your array have?
dim(my_array)

## Name the rows, columns, dimensions
rownames <- c("a", "b")
colnames <- c("A", "B", "C", "D")
dimnames(my_array) <- list(rownames, colnames, 
                           c("1st-Dimensional Array", 
                             "2nd-Dimensional Array", 
                             "3rd-Dimensional Array"))

my_array

```
